alert.note: Alert for Jo Daviess (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 07 at 10:50AM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall will continue this afternoon. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Illinois, including the following counties, Jo Daviess and Stephenson. * WHEN...Until 445 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Emergency management reports numerous roads remain closed due to flooding, and several roads have been washed out. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to recede. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1050 AM CDT, emergency management reported ongoing flooding from heavy rain early this morning. Between 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... East Branch Richland Creek, Rush Creek, Kentucky Creek, Middle Fork Plum River, Spring Branch, Muddy Plum River, Pecatonica River, South Fork Apple River, East Plum River, Cedar Creek, Preston Creek, Clear Creek, Coon Creek, Boone Branch, Indian Creek, Yellow Creek, Wolf Creek, Davis Creek, Brown Creek, Waddams Creek, Rindesbacher Creek, Lost Creek, Hells Branch, Spafford Creek, Richland Creek, Apple River, Honey Creek, Spring Creek, Rock Run, Plum River, Pink Creek, Crane Grove Creek, Silver Creek, Lilly Branch, Mud Run, Muddy Creek, Sumner Creek, Morrison Spring Branch, Winneshiek Creek, Lawhorn Creek and Wickham Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to a half inch are possible in the warned area through the afternoon. There is a threat of additional heavy rain later tonight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Freeport, Lena, Stockton, Warren, Pearl City, Cedarville, Davis, Dakota, German Valley, Apple River, Winslow, Rock City, Ridott, Nora, Buena Vista, Rock Grove, Oneco, Orangeville, Kent and Eleroy. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
